rekit.logic.level

Class BossSetting

  • java.lang.Object
    • rekit.logic.level.BossSetting

  • public class BossSetting
extends Object
    Configurable internal class that is used to store all Boss-relevant settings. These settings are, in concrete, used to determine at which x-position (=settingName) which Boss (=settingValue) is to be spawned. To enable easy access, the class supplies the method getNextOrNull, that returns a Structure or null depending of there is a BossStructure to currently return or not.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Angelo Aracri

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BossSetting(Level level) 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Structure getNextOrNull(int fromX, int toX)
      Uses information stored in the upper instance of LevelDefinition and the internal settings supplied by extending Configurable to do one of the following things: Either the settings specify a Boss (=settingValue) to be spawned because the level generation reached the threshold (=settingName) and therefore returns a fully prepared BossStructure containing a Boss already. Or there is currently no Boss to be spawned at this time (or at all) and therefore return null.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • BossSetting

        public BossSetting(Level level)

    • Method Detail

      • getNextOrNull

        public Structure getNextOrNull(int fromX,
                               int toX)
        Uses information stored in the upper instance of LevelDefinition and the internal settings supplied by extending Configurable to do one of the following things:
        • Either the settings specify a Boss (=settingValue) to be spawned because the level generation reached the threshold (=settingName) and therefore returns a fully prepared BossStructure containing a Boss already.
        • Or there is currently no Boss to be spawned at this time (or at all) and therefore return null.
        Parameters:
        fromX - the x-position in the level to start checking if a Boss must be spawned.
        toX - the x-position in the level to end checking if a Boss must be spawned.
        Returns:
        a BossStructure with a Boss attached if there must be a Boss somewhere between the given values fromX and toX, null otherwise.
